skillTree.localised_description: PLACEHOLDER
PLACEHOLDER

effects.description: Ability number of uses: +1 for "Vrrtkin Rocket"

ui_effects.localised_text: Units hit will suffer damage over time

skillTree.localised_description: Furtive, scheming, sly, cunning, underhand, devious, conniving, double-dealing, and sneaky - valuable traits if you wish to stay alive!
All Skaven are unprincipled and untrustworthy by their foul natures. However, this is rarely a disadvantage in the face of the enemy.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The power of Clan Vrrtkin is based not only on its gas warfare tactics, but also on being the weapons lab for much of the Skaven Under-Empire.
One side-effect of Trikstab's research was a chemical that caused near constant priapism amongst male Skaven. The results of such a compound being deployed are as expected.

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +3 for Skavenslave units
	(all armies factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: First and foremost amongst the warriors of Clan Vrrtkin are the Globadiers and Bombardiers.

effects.description:
Armour: +13 for Globadier and Bombardier units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +7 for Globadier and Bombardier units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: No shelter or hold is safe from the toxins of Clan Vrrtkin. Indeed, indoor spaces tend to concentrate the gases.

effects.description:
Attrition suffered by defender: +33% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

Leadership: +2 when laying siege or encircling
	(Lord's army)

Attrition suffered by defender: +66% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

Leadership: +5 when laying siege or encircling
	(Lord's army)

Attrition suffered by defender: +100% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

Leadership: +8 when laying siege or encircling
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Under the cover of noxious miasma, the elite of Clan Vrrtkin slip forward into the trenches of their foes.

effects.description:
Weapon damage: +13% for Shockrat units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +100% for Shockrat units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Attribute: Fear for Shockrat units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

effects.description:
Attribute: Stalk for Shockrat units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.

skillTree.localised_description: The best of the best populates the personal retinue of Trikstab.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -25% for Globadier, Bombardier, Poisoned Wind Mortar, and Globeclaw Catapult units
	(Lord's army)

Recruit rank: +3 for Globadier, Bombardier, Shockrat, and Carriers of the Immaculate Fume units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Nothing can resist the unending swarm of chemical warfare that results when Trikstab opens his personal ammo dump to his forces.
Lenses specially calibrated for the throwing of poisoned wind globes enhances the accuracy of the wearer.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +5%
Magic item drop chance from battle: +10%
Magic item drop chance from battle: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: This new gas mix will strip any metal, hardened skin, or scales from Clan Vrrtkin's enemies.
Enemies who flail wildly are far less of a threat to the Bombardiers and Globadiers of Clan Vrrtkin.
Experimentation has developed enhanced versions of the basic Clan Vrrtkin globes, capable of doing even more damage.
Like any good Skaven, Trikstab is interested in safety. Which is why he designed metallic armour that protects him... and allows him to flee at enhanced speed.
A powerful discharge of gasses from the warpchemical tank knocks back enemies and envelops them in a cloud of toxic gasses, allowing for a tactical advance to the rear.

ui_effects.localised_text: Units around user will suffer damage over time

skillTree.localised_description: The latest invention from the laboratories of Clan Vrrtkin is a chemical means of firing globes. It drastically increases range, at only a small cost to the wearer.
A Warpstone-enchanted breastplate and a thick steel helmet are useful to protect the wearer from shrapnel.
A small tube feeds Lord Trikstab with a cocktail of Clan Vrrtkin's best toxins, wildly boosting his battle prowess... and lowering his survival instincts.

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

skillTree.localised_description: Should the target be unfortunate enough to survive the blast; they'll meet a surer fate as their lungs are filled with Vrrtkin's signature concoctions.

ui_effects.localised_text: Units hit will suffer damage over time
Units hit will suffer damage over time

effects.description: Ability number of uses: +1 for "Vrrtkin Rocket"

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Constantly bombarding Skavenslaves with different toxic chemicals has been an interesting experiment. Those who survive tend to pick up unusual strengths.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +15% for Skavenslave units
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: +3% for Skavenslave units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +30% for Skavenslave units

	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +50% for Skavenslave units
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: +10% for Skavenslave units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: To rise above the rank and file, to claw one's way above the mire and the filth, takes a certain, superior breed of Skaven.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Clanrats units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Clanrats units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Clanrats units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Knowing exactly where and when to strike is essential when fielding fiendish, potentially battle-winning plague-weapons.

effects.description:
Ammunition: +8% for Warpfire Thrower, Warplock Jezzails, Ratling Gun, Poisoned Wind Globadiers, Poisoned Wind Mortars and Death Globe Bombardiers units

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Is it better to be respected or feared? What sort of question is that... why, both of course!

Weapon strength: +6% for Stormvermin, Death Runners, Plague Monks and Eshin Triads units

skillTree.localised_description: This one's intimate knowledge of the inner workings of Skaven machinery enables him to improve their efficiency on the battlefield.

skillTree.localised_description: The wise commander considers the lash a dear friend - so much more than a motivational tool to encourage correctness in spirit and behaviour.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Skavenslaves, Clanrats and Stormvermin units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +5 for Skavenslaves, Clanrats and Stormvermin units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Skavenslaves, Clanrats and Stormvermin units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: From the shadows of the Under-Empire flies toxic gasses and corrosive acids.

effects.description:
Range: +13% for Globadier, Bombardier, Gasthrower, Poisoned Wind Mortar, and Globeclaw Catapult units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Potions infused with Warpstone transmogrify the not-always-willing testbed subjects; those who survive the process emerge stronger and better in every way.

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for Wolf Rats, Rat Ogres, Mutant Rat Ogre, Brood Horror, Hell Pit Abomination and Plague Monks units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +5 for Wolf Rats, Rat Ogres, Mutant Rat Ogre, Brood Horror, Hell Pit Abomination and Plague Monks units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 10% for Wolf Rats, Rat Ogres, Mutant Rat Ogre, Brood Horror, Hell Pit Abomination and Plague Monks units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!
Such long-lived creatures develop a level of guile that mortals cannot match.
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
Keeping on top of things with an iron fist prevents Skavendom from becoming too much of a degenerate mess.
Naturally, rats get in everywhere  even the tiniest opening presents little obstacle  spreading their disease and corruption everywhere they can.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +1 for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +250 metres without incurring any time penalty
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +1000 metres without incurring any time penalty

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
This warrior has been ambushed previously and got themselves and many of their compatriots away safely. Such things make one naturally suspicious.
When making corpses of your foes, leave nothing of value for their kin to recover.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +5%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +10%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

Recruit rank: +1 for all units
	(Lord's army)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

ui_effects.localised_text: Units hit will suffer damage over time

factionEffects.localised_description: Sent to the Plain of Dogs by Clan Skryre to devastate an upstart Skaven clan, Trikstab Gridnode and Clan Vrrtkin have been given free reign to deploy their toxic weaponry on all the other inhabitants of the area. Once the Skaven are dead.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +20 with the faction of Clan Skryre
Ammunition and Research: +5% for Clan Vrrtkin for each active war against Skaven

Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +25%
	(all characters factionwide)
Construction cost: -50% for Weapons Dump, Weapon Barrow, Arsenal buildings

items.colour_text: A well-used gas tank belonging to the Clan Leader of Vrrtkin. It's in dire need of maintenance... but no Engineer dares to touch it.
A noxious creation of Clan Vrrtkin, these weapons spew toxic chemicals along the halberd's blade just before it strikes.

effects.description: Ability number of uses: +1 for "Vrrtkin Rocket"

ui_effects.localised_text: Units hit will suffer damage over time

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The most toxic of all members of the Under-Empire, even the Warlock Engineers of Clan Skryre stay well away when Trikstab passes by.

effects.description:
Armour: +13 for Globadier, Bombardier, Poisoned Wind Mortar, and Globeclaw Catapult units
	(Lord's army)
